intro: [WRONG START] Gnaphalium julietti, commonly known as Juliet's feather, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant typically features wiry stems and small, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Gnaphalium julietti is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky slopes and gravelly soils.
